scenario_text.value: *sigh*
Cheer up, Saki!
...That’s a tall order, isn’t it?
Saki...

If you’re feeling that bad, shouldn’t you lie
down or something?

It’s not that I’m down, it’s more like...
there’s just so much we don’t know...
Kinda hard to keep my spirits up, you know?
Yeah...

What the heck’s all this? This talk of
sacrifices or whatever...weirds me out.

Yeah...
What’s that all about?

(If we’ve been summoned here as sacrifices...
...No, hang on.)

(If we become sacrifices here...
...what will happen to us?)

(Will we get to return to our world? Will we
just die? Or maybe something else?)

Hey Takuma, what’ll happen if we become
sacrifices in this world?
Uh, well...

(That’s exactly what I was wondering. So
Saki’s worried about it, too?)
(If we become sacrifices, then...)
We can go home.
We’ll die, won’t we?
I don’t know.
Maybe we’ll be able to go back to our world.

Is that right? Then maybe we should give it
a try.
Don’t do it, Saki!
Hey, I’m just considering our options...
I know. Still, I bet that won’t get us home.
Why do you say that?

If going home was that easy, I bet people
would already know more about this world.
Well... Yeah, that makes sense.

Besides, if Floramon is so against it, then
it can’t be safe for us.

Yeah! I can’t say what’d happen, but those
jerks don’t give two figs about human kids.

I don’t wanna hand Saki over to guys like
that.
I’m glad you feel that way, Floramon.

You too, Takuma. You were trying to cheer me
up, weren’t you?
I feel a bit better now.

We’d just die, wouldn’t we? Those guys seem
way too dangerous.
Oh, jeez...
What? Why the sigh?

It’s because you’re stating the obvious,
Takuma.

Of course I know that much. I was looking for
a little hope to cling to, that’s all.

What am I supposed to do with a statement
like that? “We’d just die,” he says.

I, I’m sorry! I just didn’t want to dodge the
question!

This isn’t about dodging questions! It’s
about making a lady feel better!
I mean, I hear you, but...

Oh boy. You’ve got a lot to learn about the
ways of a woman’s heart, my friend.

I don’t know... Guessing won’t help, and
there’s no point in lying about it.

A white lie that would make me feel better
wouldn’t be all bad, you know?
I mean...

I’m kidding. If you don’t get that, I guess
sweet lies are beyond you, too.
Sorry, Saki, I dunno either...

It’s nothing to apologize for, Agumon. You
don’t know what you don’t know.

Aww man, when all’s said and done, none of us
know a darn thing.

In the end, we’ll just have to ask someone
who actually knows what’s what.
Guess that means we’ll have to fight, huh?

We’re totally clueless here. I can’t stand
it.
